text:
Hey everyone - I’ve added a form field in a custom module and I’m trying to get the option to send follow-up emails in the page editor (just like how they show up when you add a form using the HubL form tag). But for some reason it’s not coming up, even though there are these parameters in my custom module:
```follow_up_type_simple='{{ module.follow_up_type_simple }}',
simple_email_for_live_id='{{ module.simple_email_for_live_id }}',
follow_up_type_automation='{{ module.follow_up_type_automation }}',
form_follow_ups_workflow_id='{{ module.form_follow_ups_workflow_id }}'```
Hi cj! I suggest taking a look at the default form module and mimicking the fields & markup created.
Thanks Chris. I followed the steps on this page which uses the default form module, with no success: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/how-to-create-a-form-module-in-a-custom-module>

I'm noticing when using the page selector field and then outputting `{{ page_by_id(module.page_selector)|pprint}}`, in the output, you can see a `widgetsContainer` piece that goes through and lists all the output for the modules on the page. However, I am noticing that while it is outputting the choices for things like image modules, rich text, and even nested page selectors, it is not outputting `text` fields.
or it looks like its not pulling some text fields
